Key Match Events: Glenn Maxwell hit a 54* (32) to lead Australia to 168/8
Rashid Khan scored 48* (23) for Afghanistan, leading to 164/7
Josh Hazlewood took 2/33 in Australia's bowling
Adam Zampa took 2/22 in Afghanistan's bowling
Glenn Maxwell named Player of the Match
Pre-Game Insights: Naveen-ul-Haq and Fazalhaq Farooqi bowled well to restrict Afghanistan's total
Afghanistan's start was strong, but they lost four wickets consecutively
Australia's chase was challenging, but they managed to win by 4 runs
Afghanistan finished winless in the tournament
Australia's semi-final hopes are hanging by a slender thread
If England beats Sri Lanka, Australia might be eliminated
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Maxwell: 'Certainly did, Afghanistan played well, struck the ball cleanly. Started well in the powerplay and we were able to haul it back, but there was some pretty clean hitting at the end.'

Matthew Wade: 'Never really felt safe. [Eng-SL game] We'll stay here and watch that game, hoping for a bit of an upset. We put ourselves in that situation, been trying to chase a bit of run rate but it hasn’t gone our way. [Finch, David fitness?] Yeah, hopeful they’ll be right to go if we make the semis.'

Afghanistan captain Mohammad Nabi: 'Really good game of cricket. They started really well but at the end Naveen and Farooqi bowled well and it wasn't a big total on that pitch. We started well in the powerplay and the middle, but threw away four wickets back to back and that put us under pressure. [Two washouts] Tough when you play first game and then don't play for 10 days. We didn't get that momentum but improved every game from there.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather or field conditions did not significantly impact the match
Rashid Khan's blitz was crucial for Afghanistan, scoring 48* (23)
Darwish Rasooli's run out was a turning point in the match
Josh Hazlewood and Adam Zampa were key bowlers for their respective teams
Glenn Maxwell's innings was vital for Australia to secure the win
